intro: Vincetoxicum calcareum, commonly known as the limestone bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum calcareum is adapted to calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and rocky habitats.
